name: Carbamazepine ER (Tegretol XR)
summary: An extended-release formulation of carbamazepine used for epilepsy, trigeminal neuralgia, and as a mood stabilizer in bipolar disorder.
description: Carbamazepine ER (Tegretol XR) is an extended-release form of carbamazepine, an anticonvulsant and mood stabilizer. It is used to treat epilepsy, trigeminal neuralgia, and acute mania or maintenance in bipolar disorder. By blocking voltage-gated sodium channels, it stabilizes hyperexcited neuronal membranes, reduces synaptic propagation of excitatory impulses, and modulates neurotransmitter release. The ER formulation provides smoother serum drug levels, reducing peak-related side effects.

contraindications: Hypersensitivity to carbamazepine or tricyclic antidepressants

items: Acute mania and maintenance in bipolar disorder

sections.text: Blocks voltage-gated sodium channels, reducing sustained high-frequency neuronal firing and diminishing synaptic transmission.

adult.titrate: Increase by 200 mg/day every week as tolerated

sections.geriatric: Start at lower doses and titrate slowly

sections.text: Anticonvulsant effects seen within days; mood stabilization may take 1–2 weeks.

sections.black_box: Serious and sometimes fatal dermatologic reactions and aplastic anemia/agranulocytosis.
other: Screen for HLA-B*1502 in patients of Asian ancestry

items: Liver function tests at baseline, periodically

sections.pregnancy: Category D; teratogenic risk (neural tube defects)
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; monitor infant for sedation
sections.pediatrics: Approved for seizure disorders; use caution in bipolar disorder

sections.text: Gradually reduce dose over 1–2 weeks to avoid seizure recurrence or mood destabilization.

items: ER formulation provides steadier plasma levels and fewer peak-related side effects compared to immediate release
Autoinduction of metabolism may require dose adjustments after initial weeks
